main.name: Jeff Cao
main.description: I'm a second year student at the University of Chicago studying Economics spec. Data Science and Computer Science.
main.bio: In my gap year after high school and before attending University of Chicago, I travelled across Asia and worked for Beijing-based and Hong Kong-based startups, in both management and technical roles. I have experience in fintech, mobile & web design, machine learning, and product design. Other things which interest me are music, tennis, skiing, and food. Don’t hesitate to reach out if you want to collaborate!
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.degree: Undergraduate, BA in Economics with Specialization in Data Science, BS Computer Science
education.description: At UChicago, I'm the Outreach Lead of Maroon Capital (https://mc.uchicago.edu/), and a member of the TAMID group UChicago chapter.

At Milton, I was a cohead and the Portfolio Manager of the Investment Club. I was also the cofounder of Milton's Filmmaking Club, which produced two films that appeared in the All American High School Filmmaking Festival.

work.title: Quantitative Trading Intern
work.description: Coded and researched systematic trading strategies for futures markets. Optimized strategies and regression models in Python using libraries like Pandas, Numpy, & statsmodels.

work.title: Chief Technology Officer (CTO)
work.description: Co-founded Shangjing, built and managed a team of engineers for the design and production of the mobile app, working with design, project management, product deployment, user testing, etc. Led the development of the app

work.title: Front-end Software Developer
work.company_bio: Leading national Chinese Chess/Go/Checkers/etc. Competitive Tournament platform
work.description: Developed the front-end of the live online chess tournament website using React.js, GraphQL and TypeScript. Built live streaming for website’s current live national chess tournament streaming.

work.title: AI researcher, iOS developer
work.company_bio: Hong Kong-based Financial Services and mobile investing company
work.description: Built/deployed natural language processing (convolutional neural networks) models to conduct sentiment analysis of financial news articles, which is now used to give sentiment ratings in the smart web/iOS mobile investment app. Also developed the iOS app financial charting and trading indicators.

publications.title: Desire Path-Inspired Procedural Placement of Coins in a Platformer Game.
publications.description: Proceedings of the Experimental AI in Games Workshop (2018).

projects.title: UCEvents
projects.category: An event platform for UChicago students, submitted to Uncommon Hacks 2020 Hackathon

projects.title: Instagram Colors
projects.category: Model for correlating Instagram post image styles and colors with number of likes and other meta-data

projects.title: BTC reddit
projects.category: Correlating the erratic changes in Bitcoin’s price with sentiments expressed on reddit

projects.title: Autoencoder Style Transfer
projects.category: Generalized autoencoder style transfer using Feed-Forward neural networks

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
